title: Predicting Market Values of Premier League Players
description: Using neural networks to find under/over valued soccer players with the goal to aid a club's decision making process while purchasing players.

title: Numerical Analysis Program 1: Multivariable Newton's GPS
description: Using Multivariable Newton's Method and Gauss-Newton Method, we were tasked with estimating the location of a GPS tracker on Earth using the location of satellites.

title: Numerical Analysis Program 2: Trigonometric Interpolation
description: Given two popular functions, use polynomial fitting and trigonometric interpolation with Fast Fourier Transforms to interpolate while comparing errors.

title: Numerical Analysis Program 3: Poisson-Boltzmann Equation
description: Given the Poisson-Boltzmann Equation, we were asked to solve it numerically using the finite difference and finite element methods.

title: Numerical Analysis Program 4: Heat, Wave and Elliptic Equations
description: Given a certain Heat, Wave, and Elliptic equation, use iterative methods such as finite difference and forward difference to numericaly solve them.

title: Computer Networks Final
description: Given a communication network, create a graph data structure and replicate information passing by using shortest-path algorithms such as Dijkstra's algorithm and the Bellman-Ford algorithm.

title: Scientific Computing Program 1: Plotting functions
description: Given two equations of the same function, plot them at different step values, then check if the calculation is consistent with the limit of the function.

title: Scientific Computing Program 2: Newton's method and Gauss Elimination
description: Given a function of x, use Newton's Method to find all roots. Then given a Hilbert matrix, use Gauss Elimination to solve the system.

title: Scientific Computing Program 3: Solving Linear Systems
description: Given a tridiagonal matrix, use different methods and algorithms (Thomas, Jacobi, Gauss-Seidel) to solve a system.

title: Scientific Computing Program 4: Interpolation
description: Given a function based on an input number, use Chebyshev interpolation to interpolate the function. Given another function, use cubic splines to interpolate.

title: Scientific Computing Program 5: Initial Value Problems
description: Given an initial value problem (IVP), use different methods (Euler's, Adam-Bashforth, Trapezoid) to numerically solve the system.

title: Scientific Computing Program 6: Stochastic Modeling and the Langevin Equation
description: Using a biased random walk problem, simulate the probability of achieving a goal. Given a Langevin equation, use iterative methods to solve.
